description:
This collection of dashboards (**Hardware Sentry**) leverages the [`hw.*` metrics](/metric/summary?filter=hw.) collected by [Hardware Sentry OpenTelemetry Collector](https://www.sentrysoftware.com/products/hardware-sentry-opentelemetry-collector.html).

| Dashboard | Description |
|---|---|
| [Hardware Sentry - Observability & Sustainability](/dash/integration/Hardware%20Sentry%20-%20Main) | Overview of all monitored hosts, with a focus on sustainability |
| [Hardware Sentry - Site](/dash/integration/Hardware%20Sentry%20-%20Site) | Metrics associated to one *site* (a data center or a server room) and its monitored *hosts* |
| **Hardware Sentry - Host** (this dashboard) | Metrics associated to one *host* and its internal devices |

## Host

This dashboard summarizes the monitoring of a specific *host* with **[Hardware Sentry OpenTelemetry Collector](https://www.sentrysoftware.com/products/hardware-sentry-opentelemetry-collector.html)**.

Use the `$site` and `$host` dashboard variables to select the *host* to display.

A *host* can be a server, a blade chassis, a network switch or a storage system.

To configure the monitoring of a host with **Hardware Sentry OpenTelemetry Collector**, [edit the **hws-config.yaml** file](https://www.sentrysoftware.com/docs/hws-otel-collector/latest/configuration/configure-agent.html) and add an entry as in the example below.

```yaml
targets:
  - target:
      hostname: idrac-dell-23w41
      type: management
    snmp:
      version: v2c
      community: public
```

**Click on a connector > \[View documentation\] to get details about what the selected connector is able to monitor**
title: Hardware Sentry - Host

definition.query: tag:(integration:hardware-sentry) group_status:(alert OR warn OR "no data") group:(host:$host.value AND site:$site.value)
definition.title: Current Hardware Issues

definition.query: integration:hardware-sentry host:$host.value site:$site.value status:(error OR warning)
definition.title: Past Hardware Events

queries.name: query2
queries.query: sum:hw.status{$site AND $host AND state IN (ok,present) AND hw.type:enclosure} by {host,name,device_id,serial_number}
